FIGURES 5–9.
Coelotes acicularis
sp. nov.
, male and female paratypes (CAS, CASENT9025633) from Baoshan, Luoshuidong. 5,6 Female epigynum, ventral and dorsal view; 7–9 Male palp, prolateral, ventral and retrolateral view.

FIGURES 10–15.
Coelotes acicularis
,
sp. nov.
, male (13–15) and female paratypes (10–12) (CAS, CASENT9025633) from Baoshan, Luoshuidong. 10,13 Habitus, dorsal view; 11,14 Eyes, view between front and dorsal; 12,15 Labia, ventral view.

FIGURES 16–18.
Coelotes acicularis
,
sp. nov.
, male (CAS, CASENT9020393) from Baoshan, Nankang, palp, prolateral, ventral and retrolateral view, showing variation in conductor.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. —The species name is derived from Latin word “acicula”, which means “needle, pin”, and refers to the presence of a small, needle-shaped tooth on the conductor base.

Diagnosis: This new species is similar to
C. pseudoterrestris
but can be distinguished by the coiled copulatory ducts in the female and the presence of a small, needle-shaped tooth on the conductor base in the male (
Figs 1–9
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–26.
Coelotes acicularis
,
sp. nov.
, female epigyna, photos, showing variation in atrium (shape) and epigynal teeth (size and position), ventral and dorsal view. 19,20. From Tengchong County, Mingguang, Zizhi (CAS, CASENT9025625); 21,22 From Longyang County, Bawan, Bawan forest station (HNU, CASENT9025614); 23,24 From Longyang County, Bawan, Shancha He, Luoshuidong area (HNU, CASENT9022139); 25,26 From Longyang County, Bawan, Nan Kang Ya Kou (CAS, CASENT9025596).
